oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from John A. Crutchfield to Mrs. L. M. Crutchfield describing Forrest's 1864 actions in Mississippi
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter from 1st Lt. John A. Crutchfield, Co. F, 20th (Russell's) Tenn. Cav. Regt., part of Nathan Bedford Forrest's command in northern Mississippi . Crutchfield expresses confusion over where his unit will go next: Middle Tennessee or Memphis. "All I know is that Gen. Forrest will not be idle long." Refers to guerrilla depredations against citizens back in Carroll County, Tennessee.
